website_summaries.verdict: A durable replacement tire that is kind to your lawn, but you may need a professional to mount it on a wheel.
pros: Comes in a wide variety of sizes
Performs well, and the tread doesn't damage grass
cons: This options arrives compressed to such an extent that it can be very difficult to mount
No information specs on the sidewall of the tire

customer_reviews.title: Good luck.
customer_reviews.text: They're lawnmower tires. They hold air. They have lots more tread than the old ones I took off. Only problem with these, and any other lawnmower tires, they're a bear to mount. While trying to get them on the rims, I remembered that twenty years ago I swore that next time I'd have someone else mount my mower tires. How soon we forget. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: John Bowen

customer_reviews.title: I heard about fake reviews
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain came smashed like taped up collapsed and from the get go a pain. Let sit in house to warm up put heat on it would not go to shape still concave a bit. Putting it on was a pain but expected but seal it wont as edges go in on concave part of rim. Tried everything including taking off heat again no avail. Thank God and I love Amazon but they don't at this time have my LT 1040 rim and tire combo. I found one on the other site used for 21 plus 20 for delivery so I'm saved. I am being honest it was the worst headache I ever had!
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold a bead, a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Tires came as expected, left them in the summer sun for a while to allow them to get back to shape. Had them mounted yesterday. They are smaller than my originals even though they are the “same size” by spec. Would guess they are 1”-2” skinnier and maybe an inch shorter too. Haven’t tried mowing with them yet, but will update his review if there is anything important to note. Update: neither tire will hold a bead on the exact same rims I had runs my others on for years. One other note, spend the little bit more to get the 4 ply tires, these a pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Schlatter

customer_reviews.title: Tire was faulty
customer_reviews.text: Took the tire in to a local tire shop to have it put on and there is a gash in the sidewall. Wouldn't order from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: The tire is a good product but can be difficult to install on the rim.
customer_reviews.text: It was bought as a replacement tire for a Craftsman mower and matched the OEM tire perfectly. The only issue I had was inflating the tire once it was mounted to the rim. The tread of the tire was cupped inward toward the center of the tire, pushing the tire beads together. This left a 3 inch gap on one side of the tire when the other side was seated on the rim. I ended up using the 5 gallon bucket method to get the tire to inflate, that and an ample supply of prayer. Proverbs 3:5-7
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ... with my cub cadet 42" ztr spinning tires too easily when mowing
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with my cub cadet 42" ztr spinning tires too easily when mowing. I believe its called "turfing". I bought these tires and got the wider wheels from cub cadet. The original tires were 18x8.5x8----These are 18x9.5x8, and are actually almost 2 inches wider than the 8.5"s. BIG difference, not near as much spin as the tread is flat across the entire width-not rounded in the middle. There are cheaper brands out there, but they all had mixed reviews. I don't have time for mistakes because I went cheap. Carlisle makes a good tire-I'll stick with that.....
customer_reviews.author: Donna E Bailey

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: tires are to be boxed. not banded and squished.what a bunch of idiots.
customer_reviews.author: Mower Doc

customer_reviews.title: This is ridiculously difficult and it's not like I've never changed a tire before
customer_reviews.text: Can't get these to air up. I've tried everything from the bucket trick to the fire trick to the leaving them in the heat to hopefully expand to "supposed" original shape after being compressed for shipping trick, ratcheting straps, you name it. This is ridiculously difficult and it's not like I've never changed a tire before. This tire is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Tires came double folded and in a tight cardboard box
customer_reviews.text: Tires themselves were OK. For shipment, each tire was first folded first in HALF and then folded again into quarter size. Then the two tires were packed into the smallest possible cardboard box. When I got them, we mounted them onto the wheels with some difficulty, but then, due to all the folds and creases on the individual tire bodies, we could not get them to inflate. We had to take them to a tire shop and get them to install a tube in each. I did not appreciate the extra cost for the tubes in new tubeless tires!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: PURCHASED FOR FUTURE APPLICATION
customer_reviews.text: If I had purchased these for immediate use, and if they lasted and performed as well as the ones that I have on our tractor at this time, I could and would give them a full 5 Star rating. The tires that cam on our tractor were of the same brand and part number and have worked well for us for the past 12 years. My main reason for this purchase is to simply have them on had and readily available in so much as ours are getting pretty worn out by now. If these new tires work out as well as our originals,, I'd be putting a 5 Star + rating on them for sure !!
customer_reviews.author: GARY LEHL

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE !!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't touch the price and they look identical to the tubeless tires than can on my husqvarna lawn mower that is 15 years old. Dry rotted so bad I had to inflate each time I cut. But when I had to inflate before I finished my yard- 1.5 acres ...It was time for my cheapskate to get new tires. I suggest highly suggest you take them to car or tire shop that will install. Best to call first cause these were a pain even for the installer.
customer_reviews.author: RGW

customer_reviews.title: Buy the "real" replacement for John Deere replacement Rim and Tire
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these tire's to replace my tires on my John Deere riding mower...I am very handy, back yard mechanic and thought this would be a breeze. Tires arrived crushed, for shipping reasons? Didn't make any sense as the tires were still basically the same size, except with indentations in the tread. Removed old tire and installed new tire and tired everything to get air into tire (impossible) removed new tire, left out in the sun, soaked in hot water...wasted 4-5 hours. Sent back...ordered John Deere rimes and tires, installed in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Scottish

customer_reviews.title: Figured out the trick to setting the bead and inflating using a 5 gallon bucket
customer_reviews.text: The tires are anything but round when they arrive. Getting the bead to set is incredibly difficult. Once you've got the tire on the wheel, get a 5-gallon bucket and do this: 1) Put a thick, sticky tape on the rim of a 5 gallon bucket. I used gorilla tape (see picture). 2). Tape off the wheel hub so air can't flow through. 3). Place the tire and wheel on top of the 5 gallon bucket 4). Stand on the wheel hub while inflating the tire! Pressing the tire against the tape on the bucket will create a seal. Pretty soon the bead will set and you can inflate the tire to the correct pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good tire for Riding Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these tires to replace the original, dry rotted tires on a Cub Cade HDS 2135. I installed these myself without a tire machine. Tires went on with some effort but that was through no flaw of the tire. If installting the tires yourself, wear the appropriate PPE, use a tire spoon, silicone lubricant and a heat gun to warm the tire a bit. (It was cold in the garage, tires and other things shrink in the cold). Overall very pleased with the product, and as always, Amazon. P.S Dont be alarmed if the tires look like triangles when they come in. Once inflated they function with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: The MU

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for John Deere front tire
customer_reviews.text: I have a John Deere D110 tractor which had a slow puncture which finally resulted in cracks in the tire. This replacement turned out to be exactly the same size and brand as the original. Fitting was not bad, took a bit of fiddling to get the tire bead set, but after a couple of tries with a rope around it to help set it, more cleaning around the rim, and bull-snot bead sealant, it, inflated OK. A few weeks later, problem solved, holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED SERIOUSLY DEFORMED TIRES
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when they arrived. Raw tires with tape and a shipping label. Tires looked wicked deformed, but figured 'hey, they know what they're doing, probably not a big deal'. I was wrong, VERY BIG DEAL! As I am in a hurry to get my mower running because my grass is out of control I went for it. Mounted the new tires on my rims, now the difficult part...trying to get the darn things to seal and accept air. 1.5. hours of maneuvering, pulling, rolling, trying, crying and struggling I finally have 1 tire inflated!!! 3 more to go FML. While a very inexpensive replacement, next time I'll pay the extra money for ease of installation.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Widenmann

customer_reviews.title: Identical to Original Rear Tire on John Deere LA145
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say except they are identical tires to what I have on my ten year old JD LA145. I self-installed using one of those cheap Chinese mini-tire changers. I bent the threaded rod on my tire changer while breaking the bead, so be careful if you go that route. If I had to do this over, I'd buy the rear tires here on Amazon and pay a tire store to do the work. For me it wasn't worth the effort. The smaller front wheels are a different story. Those are very doable with a small tire changer or tire irons if you are interested in struggling with those.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: This is a 2PR, as in 2 ply rating NOT full 2 ply or 4 ply as some reviews state
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and managed trucking companies all my life, retired and bought a farm so I have probably bought a thousand or so tires in my lifetime. I can say I did not think it possible to manufacture a tire as thin and flimsy as this! I made a BIG mistake buying this tire and won't do so again. Yes, it's only going on a lawn mower and it will probably outlast the 1996 John Deere I put it on but still.... If you're looking for a tire, shop around. There are better ones to be found.
customer_reviews.author: Ballsar Frozenoff

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I find lawnmower tires are easy to change. I do have a bead breaker, so that may give me an advantage. When you get the new one lube the bead and the rim it up with dish soap. Put the two together, and add air. The dish soap helps seat the bead, and you’re all set. This tire is the same brand so it matches the other tires perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Direct replacement for factory tires
customer_reviews.text: Well I wouldn’t say they were easy to install. Nothing against the tires, they’re perfect, exactly replaced the factory tires. The problem was my lack of experience in getting the old tires off the rims and get these on. I chased these all over my garage trying every trick I could think of. They still whooped my butt. I’ve watched professionals change tires with spoons many times....I got this...I was wrong. The only thing I did right was I got a set of spoons for small tires which helped immensely. Otherwise I’d still be out there rolling around on the ground. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Solly

customer_reviews.title: A workout to install on wheel!
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the fact it was really deformed as delivered. Replacing the tire was tenuous. Definitely use a real tire iron for disassembly. Now seat one bead and then install ratchet strap down the middle of the new tire and another on the loose side to get the tire bead close to the wheel lip. Lots of air pressure, air volume, and manipulation needed to seat the loose bead and air up. Lastly, verify it's not your air core valve that is leaking.... Both my old core valve and old tire were dry rotted.
customer_reviews.author: HIO Silver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement on my John Deere 125
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, the tire did arrive pretty much in the approximate shape of a triangle. I pushed it out from the inside as best I could then put it on the rim while using a little soapy water. I did initially have a problem getting the bead to set but I was able to finally get it set by standing the tire up. Not sure why, but it just wouldn't set while lying on its side.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: defective, does not inflate
customer_reviews.text: Either the tire requires an inner tube or it is defective and will not inflate. I bought two of them and they are no better than the flat tire I was replacing. I bought two to have another if the other original tire went flat on the other side. I don't recommend this tire unless you want something that rolls flat. Bad thing is the hassle of taking it back off the rim to return it. They should pay for labor cost for removing it to send it back!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory West

customer_reviews.title: Fix that flat
customer_reviews.text: Are your tires rotted like most lawn tractors. This is the fix. cheap and easy to fix. get a set of spoons and put it on. Like others stated its weirdly deformed during pack n ship. and can be difficult to air up. starting fluid trick works great or the leave it in the sun trick to let it go back to its proper shape. This was not the exact model that came on my tractor but they work just fine mine had rotted on the sidewall and is 6 years old which really is good for any tire.
customer_reviews.author: montana

customer_reviews.title: Immediate shipping, good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: The tire was shipped immediately, and arrived on time in good condition. Installation was a bit of work, but the efforts required depend directly on experience and skill. I had the tire replaced within 30 minutes. The tire immediately seated against the bead, and the tire holds air perfectly. At lawnmower speeds the difference between a 2 ply and 4 ply is irrelevant and this tire is sufficient for the weight of my lawnmower, so this tire works great for me. The price is highly competitive, if you can wait the 2 days, there is no need to buy at a higher price at the box office store.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: It's a tire.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Lawn Chief and it fit perfectly. The easiest way to install the tire on the rim is to get a large bolt that fits in the center of the rim and run a nut behind it to keep it in place and make sure the bolt is long enough to go beyond the rim so that you can clamp the other side on a bench vise. Now you have control on of all the screw drivers and levers and punches and whatever to maneuver the tire onto the rim. I tortured that tire onto the rim and it did not lose it's shape and took the air fine.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Shipping Condition is lousy
customer_reviews.text: These tries show up in the collapsed in the shape of a triangle. No matter what I did I could not get them round enough to seat the bead to inflate them. I finally had to buy inner tubes for them to make these tires work. That is B.S. to having to buy inner tubes for a tubeless tire just so some corporation can save a few pennies on storage space while shipping. They have lost my business forever. I should have gone to tractor Supply in the first place and in the future I will.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Great tires, exact OEM replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Great tires and exact OEM replacements for my Husqvarna YTA19K42 riding mower. Tires shipped loose without packaging but arrived undamaged. Never mounted a tire before in my life. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous to attempt it. I’m a go getter DIY’er so I figure why not, what’s the worst that can happen? After a couple YouTube videos I had both mounted and inflated in a touch over 2 hours with nothing but a small pry bar, flat head screwdriver, a pancake compressor and some elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Not USA made China made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these tire for my son’s go cart they were exactly what was on it (BRAND & SIZE) I was a little disappointed to see they were made in China and the one that I replaced were made in the USA there definitely not the same quality as I took off so I’m guessing they won’t last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best price & quick delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is..They CRUSH the tire side to side to make it take less space for shipping. I suggest letting the tire "Breathe" for 3 days before trying to mount. I don't have a "Cheetah" bead blaster, so I spent an hour trying to mount it, could not get the bead to seal for inflation. Waited a couple of extra days (from utter frustration) and "VOILA" !!! Seated fast without issue. So if your tire comes 'crushed', don't worry..just give it 2-3 days. You will get the bead seated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Riding mower tires
customer_reviews.text: Riding lawn mower tires are notoriously challenging to change. I changed the front tires first with only minor problems, probably because I was prepared for it. For the rears, I was able to get one on after watching some Youtube suggestions. But, no matter what I tried with the last tire, which was collapsed too much, even with the help of a retired mechanic, I could not get it inflated and ended up bringing it to a tire shop. It tested them as well, and I picked it up the next day. The tires are great, just tough to mount.
customer_reviews.author: exfrteach

customer_reviews.title: New Tire came as described
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to write about on the tire, but I did review some of the tire mounting issues by other writers which were helpful. One additional item that helped me was clamping the old tire and wheel (10 years old) down on the workbench with a wood or metal clamp with some pressure at the bead. I then used a hammer and a blunt steel punch to assist in breaking the bead. This worked on both sides of the wheel. It's important to use plenty of soapy water. The install just requires some perseverance with tire tools.
customer_reviews.author: herb

customer_reviews.title: Replacment tires for the front of my JD DL-100
customer_reviews.text: Replacment tires for the front of my JD DL-100, they fit exactly. If you have never changed a 8" rim tire before, then get ready for a wrestling match. My hands felt like I had done a smack down after I was done. The old tires were easy enough to get off, but the new ones were a little harder to get started on the rim. When I was done, they sealed up and aired up just fine. These tires were exact replacements for the original tires I had on it. I have had them on for a few months now and they are still working good.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE ONE ALREADY ON THE RIM!
customer_reviews.text: The Tire itself is great. My wife had me order just the tire because she didnt want the rim to go in the landfill. If your tire is old and dried out you will have to cut it off the rim. then you will have to figure out how to heat the tire to get it installed on the new rim, because no tire shop installer can install a tire on a rim this small. THEN you will have to take the tire to another tire shop that has an industrial air compressor because no civilian air compressor has enough pressure to set the bead even if you manage to get it to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Cummons

customer_reviews.title: Great tire, not easy to put on rim
customer_reviews.text: This is a good strong 4 ply tire. It was a replacement tire for my J Deere L120, but there’s tons more this will fit on. Should last longer, be more resistant to punctures, handle sunlight and heavy loads better. The only problem. This is a B!th to get on the wheel. You need at least a tire iron and bead spoon. Seriously this was harder to get on that a car tire. Soak it it warm water if you have to. Seriously a PItA for sure.
customer_reviews.author: sean d.

customer_reviews.title: tire functions great
customer_reviews.text: well so i understand that shipping tires is not ideal but they wrapped it so tight it deformed tire. i put lead bars in to try to get back in tire shape, tried ratchet straps but was unable to seal beads. tried again after weighting with lead bars and moving tire for a week. no luck. ended up buying one of those fast releasing air tanks for tire bead setting and setup to 40psi and that did get the beads to set. overall great tire just be prepared for the bead setting
customer_reviews.author: Roundman72

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good tire, install tip here
customer_reviews.text: These are good tires. I got them on with the help of a strong buddy. It was a very tough job, it’s not even close to as easy as the online videos make it look. Don’t try it by yourself, there’s just no way unless you have a garden tractor tire installer tool. I’ve seen those for sale for $40. That’s the only way I’d ever try it solo.
customer_reviews.author: Johnazon

customer_reviews.title: Just like the original tire
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Looked and fit just like the original tire. Con: It was apparent that other tire properly had been stacked on top of the tire in storage causing the center of the tire to collapse inward to the center making it very hard to bead to seat. I had to use my tire bead seater blaster tool to get the bead to seal against the rim. Without the bead seater, I would have had to take the tire and rim to a tire shop to get the tire inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Howell

customer_reviews.title: A real bear to mount....
customer_reviews.text: These (2 tires) were delivered shrink wrapped and completely out of round. some parts of the same tire were sunken in towards the rim and other parts were sticking out... and they had obviously been stored that way for a long time as they were not popping back into shape anytime soon. Belts, ratchet straps, etc... worked to no avail to get these to mount and I ended up going to get a tube to force them into shape (even after letting them sit in the sun for a few days). Once mounted, they seem to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike_in_NH

customer_reviews.title: After 1 use it went flat
customer_reviews.text: I brought it to a service station to attach to the rim and inflate. I knew the price was too good to be true so it's my fault that I even purchased this tire. After mowing the lawn I put the tractor in the shed and a week later when I went to use it again the tire was flat. End of story.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D

customer_reviews.title: Arrived absolutely mangled
customer_reviews.text: The tire it's self is fine. The way it came "packaged" was horrible. The tire was taped up and squished so out of shape that it was collapsed even when all the tape came off. This made it absolutely impossible to seat the bead so that it would hold air. It took over 5 heat cycles in an oven to relax it enough to be able to install it. Unless you are very handy or have a very understanding tire guy, I would not recommend buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: I. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Tire, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Overall I give this 5 stars. Excellent quality, great value compared to the local home stores. My only advice is to set this tire in the Sun and let it warm up really good before trying to stretch it over the rim. Once I let the tire warm-up it popped right on the original rim with the help of a couple of screwdrivers, and inflated very easily. All total it took less than 5 minutes to install on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: KingKoolDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to put on. I soaked them in a bathtub of hot water to make them more pliable. I bought a large bolt to go through my workbench and bolt the wheel down to prevent it from spinning. Used a small pry bar to work the old tires off and put the new ones on. As other reviews stated, use a soapy water spray to lubricate. Took me less than 15 minutes to remove the old and mount the new tires.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Z

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: I used these to replace the original front tires on a John Deere L110. I chose to replace them myself, which took several pry bars and a lot of elbow grease. There are several on-line videos that show you how to replace these types of tires, which were helpful. Alternatively, you can take them and your old tires to a tire shop and they will swap them for you for a nominal fee. The old tires were worn, would not hold air, and as a result mowed unevenly. These are solid, track great, and hold air with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: You Don't Know Me But

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Carlisle tires for all my trailers. I purchased a set of Carlisle tires for my vintage Cub Cadet 108 way back in 1996. The tractor is stored outside, under a shed. Those tires still had good tread, and were holding air. But, age had finally got to them, and the sidewalls had started to crack. I rebuilt the tractor this year as my Covid-19 project... so I wanted to put some new tires on. They were shipped fast, and easy to install myself. I'll be happy to get another 24 years out of them.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.F -in NC

customer_reviews.title: Just take it to a shop.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, unless you have the tools and have done it a few times before, just take it to a shop and let them do it. I messed with it for probably an hour with 2 tire irons and dish soap before I gave up. I did leave the tires out in the sun for a couple days, no problems with them returning to the proper shape. Looks like a good tire. Put them on my Cub Cadet 2166, which originally takes an 8" wide tire. This 10" fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to set bead.
customer_reviews.text: Comes compressed, I tried two ratchet straps to set bead . Its impossible. Had to take to two tire shops before they could set the bead. And I watched as the worked very hard to get it on. Cost $20. So price plus install cost is greater then tire rim combo at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: couldn't seat
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on time but it was not in tire shape. I ended up fixing the other tire since I could not get the new tire to seat and inflate. The picture shows it with tire and rim so I was extremely dissatisfied when it arrived with tire only.
customer_reviews.author: SocialDragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I know for some products it makes me nervous about ordering and installing, this was very good process the tires were exactly as represented (thanks) and since I saved money on the tires I had them installed. With new valve stems it still only came to $14 each at the local mower service company. I had them on and got back to mowing quickly. Tires came separate with just a saran wrap to hold the shipping label, everyone on tire was good. Overall I was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Within one week the tire began cracking and losing air. Now I have to air my brand new tire up before every use. Since I paid more to have it installed on the rim than I paid for it, I guess I just have to deal with a junk tire for now.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the front tires on my 46" Ariens riding mower was leaking air and nearly bald. The Amazon replacement is an exact match to what was on it, tread and all. It took a little effort and a couple of how to videos, but after I got the tire on the wheel all I had to do was air it up. Its been on for a half a dozen mows without a refill or any other problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dadogo

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Real review here! Get them only if you dont mind putting in some effort! They came colapses looking like triangles! I heated them up with a heat gun and pretty much sculpted them back into shape. I ended up taking them to my local tire shop and they man handled them into place! I could tell it wasn’t an easy task watching the professionals struggle. They did get them to fit and charged me $25 to mount two of these tires on rims looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture shows wheel.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. My fault. When I bought this the picture showed a complete assembly (wheel and tire). I received just the tire. When I checked the listing I did finally see the last bullet point (not readily visible on my phone) said tire only. It was a bear to get on and I had to have a tire shop air it up, as my little compressor couldn't seat the bead. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Buy the tire, but let somebody else put it on the rim.
customer_reviews.text: First off, this seems to be a good quality tire. Now I'm a pretty handy guy. But after taking the old punctured tire off of the rim, I fought with this thing for over an hour trying to get it on the rim. Soapy water, multiple pry bars, nothing worked. Finally, after a lot of sweating and swearing, gave up and took it to discount tire and let them put it on the rim for $5.
customer_reviews.author: McDaniken

customer_reviews.title: Learned a new skill and a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Watched a bunch of YouTube videos on how to change the tire out on my Cub Cadet. It was a bit more difficult than they made it look, but i was triumphant. Add another skill to my ever growing list of odd things I can do. Have been running on this tire all season and it's holding up great. Will buy again if I ever need a spare.
customer_reviews.author: cerealkiller11

customer_reviews.title: SUPER difficult to seat and mount
customer_reviews.text: A jack of all trades and master of none, I take pride in doing things around the house. This includes the maintenance of outdoor equipment,etc.. That being said, your typical handyman/DIY guy WILL HAVE ISSUES MOUNTING THESE TIRES.. It took 3 of us several hours to mount 2 tires. They are a bit out of shape when they arrive and it is crazy difficult to seat them.. However, once you finally get them seated, they seem fine and worth the $42 each...THIS WILL NOT BE YOUR QUICK 10 minute job.....
customer_reviews.author: Dave Z

customer_reviews.title: A good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: I received these tires and they were out of form which seems to be a common comment. I had no problem mounting these tires but I did use a tire change fixture. I used a pancake compressor to inflate and seat these tires. I think these tires are a good value for your money. I did purchase 2 of these tires about 4 years ago for another lawn tractor and they're still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Clay R Burton

customer_reviews.title: Starter fluid and windex will save you time!
customer_reviews.text: This tire works great. Just as hard to get on as the old tire was to remove from the rim. As for getting the tire bead to seat properly,i used a ratchet strap around the centerline and then sprayed started fluid inside the tire/rim. Then i set it on fire:) Worked great! Although please do this outdoors in a safe place.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Fit craftsman riding mower
customer_reviews.text: This was really not too bad to swap out on your own. I did have my brother help me out using two pry bars to pop the old one off which for us was the hardest part. We ended up using two ratchet straps to put tension on both sides of the tire in order to get air into it. We tried with one thick strap and that just didn't do it. No more flat tire!! Oh and soap was helpful to get the new tire on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: 00AlanJ

customer_reviews.title: I can steer my lawn tractor again
customer_reviews.text: My tires were completely bald thanks to a bad alignment after bending the front end parts thanks to the terrain of my lawn. After correcting the alignment with replacement parts I still couldn't turn very well until I got these tires. They have good tread and grip the lawn just like the original ones did before I wore them out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Flood

customer_reviews.title: Probably should get 5 stars, but I'm being conservative
customer_reviews.text: This tire was an exact fit/tread style match for my 2001 Craftsman LT 2000 lawn tractor. After 19 years with the original tires, I had a leak in the side walls. This was the first time attempting to replace a tire on a rim. After watching a couple YouTube videos, I was successful. Took about an hour, but now that I know what I am doing, the next one should go a little faster. The tire seems good quality. I used a 24" tire iron which provided more leverage than a long flathead screwdriver. Had no issues getting it on.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Like all lawn equipment tires, the rims are rally small and most tire machines can't grab hold . I installed a new valve stem too . sometimes but not all are real pain in the neck to inflate .I used a fat ratchet strap around the outside of the tire to force the tire beads away from each other to seat on the rim .
customer_reviews.author: Bookster

customer_reviews.title: Easy install if you let it relax!
customer_reviews.text: Removed old tire, cleaned bead area of wheel, applied just a little silicone sealer to fill the rust pits in the wheel and slid the tire on the wheel. Sometimes a ratchet strap wrapped around the center of the tire helps push the sidewalls out toward the wheel, then just add air. No leaks, and it has been in service for about a month now. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Better than the originals
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a utility trailer. Little tires always kick my butt. This was the second one of these I bought. I took it straight to a lawnmower shop and let them mount it. I had them install a tube also. The rim it was going on was not the best quality. These tires are better quality than the cheap originals. The'll probably outlast the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love it, my garden trailer is functional again!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old large rusty steel garden tractor trailer. The tire was shot. I bought this tire and got it going again very economically. A tube for this tire cost almost as much as the tire. I bought a tubeless valve stem for $2 and got my trailer working again. I could find nothing saying this would work. But for me it does.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great tire, easy to inflate.
customer_reviews.text: The tire looks great with no apparent flaws. And unlike a lot of other tire reviews I read, the tire was not compressed in shipping. I had no problem inflating the tire. The only somewhat negative thing... I ordered two tires. One came today and the other is coming tomorrow. What the heck is that all about? UPDATE: The second tire arrived. It was compressed a little more than the first. I'm not sure why they wrap a band of tape around the tire. But with a little more effort than the first tire, I got it inflated. These are high quality tires. I highly recommend. It sure is nice not having to air tires up anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you can set the bead, they will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: As many other have said, these tires ship compressed, making them tough to set the bead. I tried many tricks without any success until I found a method of taping the holes in the rim and placing the wheel on a 5 gallon bucket while inflating. These replaced the exact same tires, which lasted over 15 years, so they are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: affordable tire but what a son of a gun to get onto the rim
customer_reviews.text: Got the tire and put it on the rim. Like dealing with a greased pig. I had tire irons and got it together finally but it's so small it's tough to hold and pry on at the same time. When ready for inflation the tire would not seat easily so I used a shot of starter fluid and a flame to force the tire to seal onto the rim. Once done it worked fine on the mower.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Tire almost unusable.
customer_reviews.text: This product was so crushed by the shipping (usually happens and it makes the tires hard to seal, but this one was too smashed) that I had to use a tube to employ it. I pulled the tube out after a week or so and it worked fine, but I was out $25 more or reorder. I'll order a Carlisle again. But having to get creative and losing time for something that should work is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: David Bays

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Sears Craftsman LT1000 tractor.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good product..as good as the original tire. My only complaint is that it is VERY difficult to install. Not really the fault of the tire or mfr. There are videos available, but take heed to not damage the bead or the tire will not seal. If you dont have a small tire machine in your garage, you're going to stuggle!!
customer_reviews.author: Slipshaft

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Appear to be very good quality. Price is excellent. Had them mounted at a local tire shop for $10 each and back on the mower in about 10 minutes. We are ready for the mowing season and actually already mowed once. 5 acres of grass requires good equipment and these tires seem to be just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: JRO

customer_reviews.title: Factory Replacement for Sears Lawn Tractors.
customer_reviews.text: Watched my son try and mount an off brand tire for two hours without success. Told him I would handle it. Took the rim home and ordered a Carlisle Turf Saver and mounted and aired it up in under 5 minutes. Safe yourself the frustration and buy a Carlisle tire from the get go. (26 year Sears Service professional).
customer_reviews.author: The Concrete Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: The tire fit my older John Deere 316
customer_reviews.text: The tire fit my John Deere 316 without issue. Since I do not have a tire instillation "stand" it took a bit of effort to put the tire on the rim by using two pry tools and a vise-grip tool. However I was able to accomplish the task in able an half hour working from the ground in my drive way. The tire formed to the rim without a problem and readily inflated using an air hose connected to a compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Schoppert

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This tire was so mishaped when we received it, it is virtually unusable. This had been a 4 day project and now, it's on... and it's leaking. A nightmare. Save your money and your time....
customer_reviews.author: melanie wagner

customer_reviews.title: totally misunderstood description
customer_reviews.text: we thought this tire was coming on a rim, it did not. The photos show the tire mounted on a rim. We took the wheel off the mower and took it to 5 different tire places, all were UNABLE to get the tire on the rim. After a lot of manurving and tries and fails, it took 3 of us to get the tire on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: K.Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Why won't they let me correct the order error right when I see it?
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine...I've been having difficulty with my orders from Amazon in that the majority of the time they send 2 instead of the just 1. And when I've tried to alert them to the fact and immediately, they say I can send it back or refuse to take it. Well, that doesn't work well for me. I now own extra phone covers, sdcards, gold chains and a lawn tire... ridiculous to send back, wouldn't u think?
customer_reviews.author: Oreo June

customer_reviews.title: Buy these for a few bucks more-well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Good Product, glad I went to the Carlisle. Were not too hard to get on. Hardest part was popping the beads on the old tires. Used a small crowbar and a few screw drivers. 2 tires took my about 20 minutes from start to finish. I let tires sit in the Carolina sun for a few hours and soaped the bead/inner lip of the rims. I will make sure I put tire dressing on these so they sidewalls don't dry out and lead like my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: derek

customer_reviews.title: I bought a tube to get it to inflate
customer_reviews.text: Good tire, but hard to seal the bead on the rim. I have a manual tire changer at my job, which aided in putting the tire on the rim. My trouble came when I went to air it up and seal the bead. I tried a tie down strap to force the tire to seal, no luck. I tried the ole starting fluid and flame trick about six times. No luck either. I bought this tube, (Trans American 23x8.50-12 / 23x9.50-12 / 23x10.50-12 Inner Tube with TR-13 Straight Valve Stem), put it inside the tire and it aired right up and sealed. I do golf course mechanic work and Carlisle makes a good tire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tires for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these for our mower .when they arrived they had been mashed on the side to the point they would not take air at all .I contacted seller and they made things right . We would order again should we need to. The tire its self is a good tire for the money mowed with them today an was pleased .
customer_reviews.author: cindy blankenbeker

customer_reviews.title: Got the old tire off and back on with hydraulic spreader. but had to pay to have bead set.
customer_reviews.text: Good tire. Professional installation advised. I got the old one off and this one on with the help of two tire irons and a hydraulic ram tool. Couldn't set the bead because tire needs to expand to seat on wheel. So, unless you have a bead setter, you will need to pay someone to do this. Great tire though!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Can't seal
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to work with. Bought 4 tires 4 years ago and no problem. The sidewalls of these tires are so caved in that when one side is against the rim the other side is about 4 inches from the rim. Yes they are the right size for the rim, an exact replacement for my old tire. Tried ratcheting, ropes, 5 gallon bucket. I will end up getting an inner tube. Zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: tjmaj

customer_reviews.title: Can't Inflate
customer_reviews.text: I was only able to inflate one tire, I tried everything to inflate and was unable due to it being disformed, I even took it to a golf cart repair man, he was unable to inflate and just put a tube in it. I should have returned but I needed to cut my grass ASAP. Do not except if disformed, you wont be able to correct with air.
customer_reviews.author: MRichey

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this tire! It is for our utility wagon. We have hauled many pounds and many loads of firewood already and it has held up better than a more expensive one we purchased. It is a little challenging to put on the rim, but my 66 year old husband can do it by himself. I would definitely order this tire again.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Sams

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tire.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect on my John Deere GX255. Tire was compressed for shipping. I hung it over my shop heater while removing the old tire. That softened the rubber. Rubbed some dish soap on it and it was not difficult to mount. Drew a strap around the center of the tread, put air to it and it quickly sealed to the rim.
customer_reviews.author: KJL

customer_reviews.title: Carlisle tires rate amongst the best for small equipment tires.
customer_reviews.text: Just like any tire to dismount and mount, knowledge is key. Been mounting tires for years in my garage with simple tools. It can be done just take your time and maybe take in a instructional YouTube video or 2. Tires are great and a exact replacement for my wagon tires.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosierwaterfowlers

customer_reviews.title: VERY hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace front tires on a go cart. Appear to be good quality for the price. That being said they were a bear to mount. Tried ever trick I knew, watched all the YouTube videos I could find with no luck. Finally purchased a mini tire changer. Even then it still took some work and trial and error to get them mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Donald D Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement tires!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older lawn tractor and the tires kept going flat, so I purchased these. I took them to my local tire store and had them mounted on the wheels and the old ones tossed. I like the look and feel of them. Have had no problems with flats. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For My Cub Cadet
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been a mechanic so the process to inflate and get back on the rider was a learning experience. I basically had a tire shop inflate and set the bead on the wheel. My dad taught me how to disassemble, grease and reassemble. The value and quality I think is great. The rider is back in action!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: These are good tires, but-----------They come shipped pressed down flat so its almost impossible to get them to inflate, I had to take them to the local tire shop to get them inflated and they even had problems with them. Not sure whos bright idea that was to smash them before shipping, total waste of time, i suggest not to buy them, its worth going to the tire shop and buying from them already mounted and done, it will save you money and grief.
customer_reviews.author: Randy and Karla Bevan

customer_reviews.title: No more leaky tires!
customer_reviews.text: Identical to the sears branded tires on my mower. Easy to install with some blunt screwdrivers and dishsoap. If you have an older mower(+20yrs) be prepared to clean up the inner rim of rust or the new tires won't seal. Recommend you replace the stems while you are in there.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: But a tire vs buy tire and wheel combo?
customer_reviews.text: Took these to Les Schwab had the old taken off and new put on. Probably some way to do it at home, but I didn't know how and didnt want to mess with it this week... $16 each tire. Wondered if I could have bought a new tire + wheel for close to same price when all said and done. Good tires...
customer_reviews.author: d funk

customer_reviews.title: Front Mower Tires
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement for worn-out tires for John Deere D140. As normal it was slightly difficult to install because of the small ID. Placed ratchetting tie-down around circumference and tightened it to spread beads against the rim. After doing this, the tires aired up easily.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great tire. always tough to mount and air up.
customer_reviews.text: These little tires are always hard to inflate the first time. Also difficult to put on the rim. Need to have tire spoons and a couple of racket straps to help the bead to seat. Patience too. Put an inner tube in tire in the sun to help open beads up before mounting. Leave for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Henry G.

customer_reviews.title: Use a good technique to mount them
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to install tried like crazy first day and was beaten by the tires. Next day I’m determined to get them on. Lacking hot sun I put them in a large box with a blow dryer for about 15 minutes. Then I used 2 tie down ratchet straps on a tire careful to line them up to get bead close to the edge of the rim. Removed valve stem and shot them with straight air and presto they were seated. Moral of the story is technique and brain beats brain. Day one I tried to muscle them on and they kicked my but. They are nice tires!! Hello
customer_reviews.author: spanky

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: Needed these to replace units on my tractor which were 35 years old and weather checked to the point they would not hold air. Other than being hard to inflate, they are great. Had to put a rachet strap around the circumference and use dish soap to get them to seal.
customer_reviews.author: hardrocko

customer_reviews.title: It's A Lawn Tractor Tire
customer_reviews.text: It's a lawn tractor tire. It's not like you need it to withstand high speeds on the Autobahn. You can't beat the price. As with all tires, it's hard to install if you don't have the equipment or don't know what you're doing. Inflation is typical of this size tire.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Howard Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Arrived On Time
customer_reviews.text: While the tire works great and is as advertised. I found getting it to seat on the rim very difficult. The pliability of the tire's sidewalls make it a chore to get the whole tire in line at the same time so the pressure from the air compressor can be used to seat the tire on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank You, Carlisle Tire/Seller.  Same as Craftsman OEM tires.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly. Thank you. Tires were same as OEM Craftsman Riding Mower tires. Hard to install w/o 2nd person and/or proper tools/equipment. But, worked out really well. Mower is over 10 years old, so now can extend useful life, a bit. Thanks, Carlisle Tire/Seller.
customer_reviews.author: m.f.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. Great Tires
customer_reviews.text: They were difficult to install on rim but I expected that. They were also impossible to inflate. Took them to tire shop to inflate. The quality seems good. Bought two to replace front tires worn, after ten years. Use mower this week, much improved handling.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good tires - no real issues with shipping conditions or mounting.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant to buy these after reading all of the reviews but took a chance. Mine came delivered unboxed and no straps crunching the tires. They were held together with packing tape. A little compressed around the centers but not bad. I placed them on our heat registers overnight to warm them up and make them a little more pliable. All in all - it took me about 1/2 hour per tire to mount them on my Cub Cadet tractor.Have the right tools - pry bars or large screwdrivers. Takes some patience. Maybe I got lucky - but very happy with the quality of tires and the price.
customer_reviews.author: guildltc

product_meta.title: Carlisle Turf Saver Lawn & Garden Tire - 15X6-6 A
product_meta.description: Size:15X6-6With its classic square shouldered design, the Turf Saver tire is the market leader for residential riding lawn mowers worldwide. The flat profile and chevron tread provide excellent traction. Its turf-friendly design and breadth of line make it versatile in both application and fitment.
feature_bullets: Enhanced durability with its broad-shouldered, puncture resistant construction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,516 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
